bibl.title: Letter from D. S. Fairchild, Jr. to Henry Rose Carter, May 10, 1921

div1.p: Fairchild informs Carter that Beverly of Medical Corps is at Langley Field, Virginia.

div1.head: Letter from D. S. Fairchild, Jr. to Henry Rose Carter, May 10, 1921
div1.opener:
IN REPLY REFER TO S. G. O. 201-Beverly, Edward P.,
MCG.
WAR DEPARTMENT
OFFICE OF THE SURGEON GENERAL
WASHINGTON
May 10, 1921.
H. R. Carter, Ass't Surgeon General,
2121 California St., N.W.,
Washington, D.C.
Sir:
div1.p:
The Surgeon General directs me to acknowledge
receipt of your communication of May 5, 1921, and in reply
to inform you Major Edward P. Beverley, Medical Corps, is,
at present, stationed at Langley Field, Hampton, Virginia.
div1.closer:
Very truly yours, D. S. Fairchild, Jr.,
Lt. Col., Medical Corps, U.S. Army. ALL COMMUNICATIONS SHOULD BE ADDRESSED TO “THE SURGEON GENERAL, U. S. ARMY, WASHINGTON, D. C.”
